intro: Silene venosa subsp. vulgaris, commonly known as the common redstem, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems that are often reddish in color, especially when mature. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It is typically found in grassy areas, roadsides, and disturbed soils across temperate regions. Silene venosa subsp. vulgaris is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to cultivate and is sometimes used in garden settings for its ornamental value.
